thread.title: LogiNext opens its SaaS platm for overseas markets
thread.title_full: LogiNext opens its SaaS platform for overseas markets - The Economic Times

author: Payal Ganguly
title: LogiNext opens its SaaS platm for overseas markets
text:
BENGALURU: Logistics management software provider LogiNext has opened its software-as-a-service or SaaS platform for clients across 100 overseas markets. 

The Paytm-backed company is in discussions with large retailers such as Walmart and Sears to sell the enterprise software for field workforce management. It recently signed on a large franchisee for food retail in West Asia as well as a nuclear power producer in the United States to provide its software. 

"We decided to get into this as we can get global clients to sign up on the platform, which is free for 15 days and is a paid offering following that. We have seen multiple sign-ups within 24 hours of opening up the platform, with majority of requests coming in from retail, FMCG and traditional sectors," said LogiNext CEO Dhruvil Sanghvi. 

The SaaS model, which is opened for registration across 100 countries, is yet to be launched in India, where LogiNext works with clients such as Myntra , Unilever , Coca Cola and Suzuki on an offline basis. 

"We launched in other markets first as the self-service model works best outside of India. We have also uploaded video and other guides online for the companies to understand the tools on our platform," Sanghvi said. 

The company has set up sales offices in Dubai and the US to tap into clients in these markets. The software platform costs up to $100,000 per annum for some of the larger clients.
